intro: Hymenoxys richardsonii var. macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered hymenoxys, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically showy blooms. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces tall, branched stems that bear numerous yellow to orange flowers. Its flowers are typically larger than those of the typical variety, with showy ray florets. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
